article.description: Marcus Johnson Jr. matched a career-high with seven 3-pointers and finished with 24 points, and Arkansas-Little Rock cruised to an 80-67 victory over Georgia Southern on Thursday night.
article.headline: Arkansas-Little Rock cruises past Georgia Southern 80-67
article.linkText: Arkansas-Little Rock cruises past Georgia Southern 80-67
article.story: LITTLE ROCK, Ark. -- Marcus Johnson Jr. matched a career-high with seven 3-pointers and finished with 24 points, and Arkansas-Little Rock cruised to an 80-67 victory over Georgia Southern on Thursday night. The Trojans (18-2, 8-1 Sun Belt Conference) have won eight of their last nine games and are off to their best conference start. Johnson was 8 of 13 from the floor. Roger Woods had 15 points, and Josh Hagins added 10 points and six assists for Arkansas-Little Rock, which shot 51 percent from the floor. Tookie Brown scored 17 points and Mike Hughes had 16 to lead Georgia Southern (7-12, 3-6). Arkansas-Little Rock had a double-digit lead midway through the first half and built a 41-28 halftime lead. Johnson scored 12 points in the second half, and his 3-pointer stretched the Trojans' lead to 74-59 with four minutes left.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
